acqinfo.head: Acquisition Information
acqinfo.p: This collection was a gift to the library on 1986 June 4.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content Information
scopecontent.p: The collection contains typescripts of three comedy-dramas by Gresham: The whetstone,rewritten as Woman, with a difference,and That lesser Aphrodite.In addition there is a typescript copy of Death takes a holidayby Walter Ferris, with Gresham's acting "sides" containing stage directions; and portions of the script for Edgar Allan Poe's Politian.

did.unittitle: The Whetstone, a comedy-drama in three acts, by Elizabeth Fenner Gresham. "As given at Va. summer '36 under title Detour to Success" [ante 1936]
Woman, with a Difference, a comedy-drama in three acts, by Elizabeth Fenner Gresham. "As written, after production/summer '36-to present to N.Y. agents" [a rewrite of The Whetstone] 1936
That Lesser Aphrodite, a comedy-drama in three acts, by Elizabeth Fenner Gresham. "As given U.Va., Jan. 1937" [ante 1937]

Death Takes a Holiday, a comedy in three acts, by Walter Ferris. Acting "sides" containing stage directions for the production at the University Theatre, January 30 & 31, 1936, used by actress Elizabeth Fenner Gresham n.d.
Politian, a tragedy, by Edgar Allan Poe. [Portions of the script used for a production at the University of Virginia] n.d.
